uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.jdbc

Interface DatabaseService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AppContextCleanup, AppContextService<DatabaseService>, CloseRegistry, Contexed
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultDataBaseService, JNDIDatabaseService, WrappedDatabaseService

    public interface DatabaseService
extends Contexed, AppContextService<DatabaseService>, CloseRegistry
    A service that supplies the DataBase Connection

      • inTransaction

        boolean inTransaction()
        Are we already in a transaction
        Returns:
        boolean

      • transactionStage

        int transactionStage()
        returns the number of times commitTransaction() has been called since the last transaction start. If this returns 0 then a roll-back will return to the state at startTransaction() if greater than zero there have been intermediate commits. To aid in testing the value is not reset to zero until the next call to startTransaction()
        Returns:
        int

      • startTransaction

        void startTransaction()
        Start a database transaction Transactions cannot be nested so use inTransaction() if possible doubt.

      • rollbackTransaction

        void rollbackTransaction()
        Abort changes since start or last commit

      • commitTransaction

        void commitTransaction()
        flush changes since start of last commit. Unlike the commit method of a Connection this is a NOP if not in a transaction. Call before an operation that modifies external state as these won't roll-back. However probably better to defer the external state change using the CleanupService unless the transaction phases all make sense in their own right.

      • stopTransaction

        void stopTransaction()
        finish transaction (includes commit).

      • handleError

        void handleError(java.lang.String message,
                 java.sql.SQLException e)
          throws DataFault
        Handle an unexpected database exception. Most of the time this will just re-throw the exception wrapped in a DataFault however this also allow special handing of certain classes of error such as SQLTransientExceptions
        Parameters:
        e -
        Throws:
        DataException
        DataFault

      • logError

        void logError(java.lang.String message,
              java.sql.SQLException e)
        handle an SQLException directly. Normally this will just log the error however this also allow special handing of certain classes of error such as SQLTransientExceptions
        Parameters:
        message -
        e -
